subject: AI & Agents
title: Bounding Boxes: Where Is the Object?
description: A 60-second lesson on Bounding Boxes: Where Is the Object?.

hook.text: Draw a rectangle around the dog in the photo. That rectangle is a bounding box.

buildup.text: Object detection predicts both the class (dog, car, person) and the bounding box location.

discovery.text: A bounding box is defined by four numbers: x, y, width, and height.

twist.text: Overlapping objects need multiple boxes. Occlusion makes the problem much harder.

climax.text: IoU (intersection over union) measures how well a predicted box matches the ground truth.

punchline.text: Find it. Box it. Label it.

quiz.question: What does IoU measure in object detection?
options: Overlap between predicted and ground truth bounding boxes
